segments.text: Same here.Have you seen any new films recently ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I haven't had a chance to . But I have been watching a Chinese TV scries called " Chinese-Style Divorce " .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh . really ? I saw it two years ago . It's worth seeing and it's thought-provoking .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah . I found it is so close to our life .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It reflects some of our difficulties in this ever-changing world .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You said it . You know , the divorce rate has been on the rise in recent year .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , it's said that a lot of young people favor getting married quickly which tend to end quickly too .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I know a couple who divorced a week after getting married .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's true . It's said the short-lived marriage is typical of the post - 80s ' generation .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: II can't agree more . The only-child-generation in China tends to know little about marriage .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Definitely.They don't take relationships and marriages very seriously .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: In their mind , love is nothing but passion and marriage is over once the passion is gone .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think , as the saying goes haste makes waste , it is the same with marriage .
segments.speaker: S2
